decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: C.100 (Location Plan); C.101 (Existing Block Plan); C.102 (Existing Ground Floor and Cellar Plan); C.103 (Existing First Floor, Second Floor, and Roof Plan); C.104 (Existing Front and Rear Elevations); C.105 (Existing Side Elevations); C.106 (Existing Sections); P.302 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan and Cellar Plan); P.303 (Proposed First Floor, Second Floor, and Roof Plan); P.304 (Proposed Front and Rear Elevations); P.305 (Proposed Side Elevations); P.306 (Proposed Sections); Design and Access Statement prepared by Hodgkinson Design dated 10.09.2021; Noise Survey Report prepared by KP Acoustics; Tree Protection Plan; Tree Protection Method Statement
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies HC1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012  ), and the Mount Park Conservation Area Management Plan.
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
| The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the submitted Tree Protection Plan and Tree Protection Method Statement

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan 2021, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's tree Strategy.

| (A) Prior to the commencement of the development, details of the external rating noise level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures as appropriate shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.  The measures shall ensure that the external rating noise level LAeq emitted will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all plant/equipment operating together at maximum capacity.

(B) Prior to the first use of plant and equipment, a post installation sound assessment shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The assessment shall be carried out to confirm compliance with the noise criteria set out in Part A of this condition and shall include additional steps to mitigate noise as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the surrounding premises are not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Single storey side/rear extension, conversion of a garage into storage/plant/cycling space (following demolition of existing single storey rear, side and first floor additions); Installation of one  air conditioning condenser and two air source heat pumps on the roof of the side extension; alterations to rear elevation first floor fenestration involving replacement of window (following demolition of first floor rear extension;  alterations to loft fenestration replacement of one window;  landscaping to front
